title: Twisted River 2017 Bin 168 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Savory hints of hay and barley permeate through sweeter tones of candied pineapple and yellow cherry in this medium-dry Riesling. It's approachably plump and fruity but has bright acidity. A slightly rustic wine to enjoy now.

title: Viña Vilano 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of wood grain, mint, clove and smoke ride into a rock-hard palate with fierce tannins. Burnt oak, black fruit and hard-spice flavors give way to heat and forced spice on the finish.

title: 4 Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Black raspberry, black currant, spice, green pepper and reductive aromas are followed by soft, plump black currant flavors, with the concentration seeming light. It needs more structure to stand it up.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Gemini Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll have to look closely to spot the Gemini designation on the front label, that differentiates this from the estate's Trouble cuvée. Leathery aromas and flavors dominate, along with sweet grape candy, but then the bitter tannins take over.

title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
description: This is an attractive crisp, bubbly wine with lively acidity and some sweetness. It is fruity with ripe apples and lightly perfumed. Drink now.

title: BK Wines 2015 One Ball Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This wine carries bright citrus and toasted nut aromas, masked by an oniony note that blows off some with time. The palate comes with a chalky texture and a pithy, spicy bite.

title: Bleasdale NV The Red Brute Sparkling Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)
description: A classic Shiraz nose of ripe cherries, plums, chocolate and earthy, peppery spice leads into a rich, velvelty-textured palate that is equally fruity and spicy. Gentle bubbles and some sweetness gives this wine a slightly lazy feel.

title: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This fresh, light and creamy wine is bright with citrus flavors. Its herbal nature is still young but is attractive for its upfront, fruity character. Drink this wine now.
designation: Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc

title: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Ruettes  (Sancerre)
description: This soft, ripe wine is made to be instantly drinkable. The texture hints at minerality while it is also full of rich white fruits, a rounded texture and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Chakana 2016 Nuna Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grapy aromas of cassis and purple flower are jumbled. This is high in acidity but short on depth and richness. Tart black fruit flavors are smacking and taste of saline on an acidic finish.

title: Coelho 2016 Bunny Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The so-called Bunny Cuvée refers to the unnamed front label graphic of a rabbit, which adorns this new series of inexpensive Coelho wines. This is as light as a feather, with scents of mushrooms and flavors of salmonberry.

title: Innocent Bystander 2017 Moscato (Swan Hill)
description: This syrupy sweet bubbly comes with a pretty sunset hue, ultraripe aromas of red berry, watermelon candy and grape juice. At 5.5% abv, this could be an easy sipper ice cold with a dessert like raspberry tart.

title: Lujon 2017 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This new vintage is not optimally ripened, and it carries a touch of shallot in the nose. Despite its 25 g/L of residual sugar, it remains disjointed, with an awkward mix of grapy sweetness and wild greens. Another year in bottle should help smooth it out.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy aromas of oak and tobacco meet brandied cherry and plum about halfway. On the palate, this is screaming with acidity, making for a shrill mouthfeel. Flavors of oaky vanilla and sour cherry finish with sizzle and sour red-currant notes. The most notable problem is unresolved pesky acidity.

title: Paumanok 2016 Minimalist Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: This spontaneous ferment Chenin offers aromas of sauced apples and pears on the nose. Light in feel, the palate is straightforward in nature, displaying spiced tree fruit flavors carried along by a healthy vein of acidity.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2017 Assobio Rosé (Douro)
description: The wine is ripe and soft with red-berry fruits and touches of caramel. It has a rounded character, it's full of fruitiness and it has a gentle texture. Drink this easy wine now.

title: Sanguinhal 2017 Sottal Leve White (Lisboa)
description: Perfumed Moscatel is cut by crisp Arinto and Vital in this lively wine with its light frizzante character. It is fruity, crisp with citrus and with an edge of sweetness. Drink the wine immediately.

title: Taliano 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of chocolate-covered raisin, withered violet and camphor emerge from the glass. The raw palate offers espresso, coconut and prune while grainy, astringent tannins clench the finish.

title: Thierry Delaunay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: Very herbal and crisp, this currant-flavored wine is all fruit and acidity. It has hints of more tropical flavors as well as an attractive perfume. Drink the wine now.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2014 Pago Valdebellón Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Damp, mossy, earthy berry aromas are murky as a whole. This Cabernet is massive and pounding on the palate, with tannins as hard as nails. A green-leaning flavor profile with coffee, mint and blackberry notes finishes with heavy oak, burnt toast and green spice flavors.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
